member.name: F:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.AddressLabel.addressDisplayFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the appropriate method for displaying the patient's address. Sets the address layout to be either inform (vertical) or inline (horizontal).
member.remarks: If the address layout is set to inform, each line contains a single, left-justified element with no separator characters displayed. If the address layout is set to inline, multiple elements display on a single line, with address elements separated by a single comma and a single space. Individual address elements should not split across multiple lines.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.DateInputBox.Functionality
member.summary: Specifies the functionality exposed by the DateInputBox as "Simple" or "Complex".
member.remarks: Defaults to "Complex" so the DateInputBoxs complete functionality is exposed. If this is set to "Simple", only a simple date can be entered such as DateInputBox.Date.DateValue. If the functionality is set to "Simple", the DateInputBox allows other values, such as AllowApproximate and DatePeriod, to be got and set; the control does not, however, respond to these values. In addition, attempting to set the Value.DateType or DateType to any value other than DateType.Exact throws an argument exception.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.NameLabel.FamilyName

member.remarks: The NameLabel control capitalizes the family name. The maximum display length is 40 characters. If the data exceeds 40 characters, it is truncated to 37 characters plus an ellipsis.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.NameLabel.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the patient's title.
member.remarks: Parentheses are automatically put around the title. The title is only dispayed if one of FamilyName or GivenName is also provided. The maximum display length is 35 characters, including parentheses and three spaces.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeInputBox.Display12Hour
member.summary: Specifies whether hours should be displayed in 12-hour or 24-hour format.
member.remarks: Defaults to false. If the time is 1:30 in the afternoon, this displays as 01:30 in 12-hour format and 13:30 in 24-hour format. Although the control currently support both 24 hour and 12 hour clock the use of 12 hour clock is NOT supported for safety critical environments, and the ISV has a responsibility to use the controls in a manner appropriate to the clinical context.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeInputBox.DisplayAMPM
member.summary: Specifies whether an AM/PM suffix should be included.
member.remarks: Defaults to false. AM refers to times from 00:00 to 11:59:59. PM refers to times from 12:00 to 23:59:59

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeInputBox.Functionality
member.summary: Specifies the functionality exposed by the TimeInputBox as "Simple" or "Complex".
member.remarks: Defaults to "Complex" so the TimeInputBoxs complete functionality is exposed. If this is set to "Simple", only a simple time can be entered such as TimeInputBox.Time.TimeValue. If the functionality is set to "Simple", the TimeInputBox allows other values, such as AllowApproximate and TimePeriod, to be got and set; the control does not, however, respond to these values. In addition, attempting to set the Value.TimeType or TimeType to any value other than TimeType.Exact throws an argument exception.

member.summary: The wrapper for Value.From.
member.remarks: Represents the date and time which mark the start of the time span.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeSpanInputBox.Granularity
member.summary: The wrapper for Value.Granularity.
member.remarks: Specifies the largest units to be displayed. If IsAge is true, the granularity is set from the time span. If IsAge is false, the granularity is set from the assigned granularity value. The granularity may be seconds, minutes, weeks, hours, days, weeks, months or years.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeSpanInputBox.IsAge
member.summary: The wrapper for Value.IsAge.
member.remarks: Specifies whether the time span represents an age.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeSpanInputBox.Text
member.summary: The wrapper for Value.ToString() when getting and Value.ParseExact when setting.
member.remarks: Returns or accepts the time-span as a formatted string.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeSpanInputBox.To
member.summary: The wrapper for Value.To.
member.remarks: Represents the date and time which mark the end of the time span.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeSpanInputBox.Threshold
member.summary: The wrapper for Value.Threshold.
member.remarks: Specifies the smallest units to be displayed. If IsAge is true, the threshold is set from the time span. If IsAge is false, the threshold is set from the assigned threshold value. The threshold may be seconds, minutes, weeks, hours, days, weeks, months or years.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeSpanInputBox.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the timespan entered in the input box.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeSpanInputBox.UnitLength
member.summary: Specifies whether long or short units are displayed.
member.remarks: Defaults to "Short". If long units are specified, the entire unit name is included, such as "month" or "minute". If short units are specified, an abbreviated form of the unit is included, for example "m" for month or "min" for minute. Singular and plural versions of the short and long units are included automatically as appropriate.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.WinForms.TimeSpanLabel.UnitLength
member.summary: Specifies whether long or short units are displayed.
member.remarks: Defaults to "Short". If long units are specified, the entire unit name is included, such as "month" or "minute". If short units are specified, an abbreviated form of the unit is included, for example "m" for month or "min" for minute. Singular and plural versions of the short and long units are included automatically as appropriate.
